name: Breakup Edition
backDesc:
The end of a relationship
 is the beginning of a new
 one... with yourself
preview: Breakups are important. They teach us about ourselves. They show us what we want and what we don't. They allow us to move away from what isn't for us – and closer to what is. They even show us parts of ourselves we need to break up.

We've created this edition as a tool to self-reflect after a breakup. Journal your answers or play with a friend who can be a soundboard for your healing process. The end of a relationship is the beginning of a new one… with yourself.
questions:
What has helped you
 heal from a heartbreak
 in the past, besides time and
 meeting someone new?

After your most recent
 breakup, what song did you
 play on repeat?

Picture you're talking to
 your ex. Finish the sentence:
 You hurt me, but thank
 you for _________.

What have all your
 previous relationships
 had in common that you'd like
 to avoid moving forward,
 if anything.

Did their love leave you
 feeling good most of the time?
 If not, what was the dominant
 feeling they left you with?

Were you lying
 to yourself about
 anything during your
 last relationship?
 If so, what was it?

What did your last
 relationship make you
 appreciate about
 yourself?

What are 3 things you can
 appreciate about being single
 (even if it feels hard)?

Are you talking to
 other people currently? If
 so, are you seeking a real
 connection or needing
 a distraction?

What part of your last
 relationship worked? What
 part of it hurt?

Do you want closure
 or just an excuse to talk
 to them? Explain.

How can you show up
 for yourself when no
 one else can?

How has your last
 relationship prepared
 you for your next one?

What parts of yourself do
 you need to break up with?

What would feel best
 to fully accept in this
 current moment?

Who in your life has
 been treating you right
 lately? Let them know before
 moving on to the next card.
 (Exes not included.)

How did you get
 over your first
 love?

Were you more attracted
 to their potential or who they
 really were? Explain.

What title would you
 give this chapter of your
 healing process?

Would you encourage
 your future child to be in a
 relationship like your last?
 Why or why not?

What story about love
 have you been telling yourself
 that no longer serves you? How
 would you like to change
 that story?

What can you be doing
 now with all the energy you
 were putting into them?

What's the best lesson
 an ex has ever taught you?

What were you
 over-rationalizing
 throughout your
 last relationship,
 if anything?

Do you have a limiting
 belief about love? Where
 do you think it stems from?
 How can you challenge this belief?

What can you do for
 yourself today, even if
 you don't enjoy it, to make
 future you happy?

Did your last
 relationship reveal some
 toxic traits in yourself that
 you'd like to work on? If so,
 what are they?

What is your heart
 telling you? What is your
 mind telling you?

What do you want
 to receive from a future
 relationship? What do
 you want to give?
 Get specific.

Were there any patterns
 in your previous relationship
 that you're newly aware of?
 If so, what were they?

Significant other aside,
 when you visualize coming
 home to a life you love, what
 does that look like?
 Get specific.

What was the biggest
 turning point in your
 dating life?

What validation are you
 seeking from a partner? How
 can you give it to yourself?

Imagine you're talking to
 your ex. Finish the sentence:
 I'm sorry for _________.

What's your ex's name
 and one thing about them?

Did you like your ex as a
 person? Or were you just in
 love? Explain.
What feels unique about this heartbreak, if anything?

What advice would you
 give a friend or loved one
 going through a similar
 situation as you?
If you could ask your ex one thing and get a completely honest answer, what would it be?

Wild Card Write down 3 things
 you love about yourself that aren't physical.

Wild Card Write a note to your future
 self. Fold and place somewhere
 safe. Set a reminder to open
 3 months from today.

Wild Card Write a stand up routine about
 your last relationship. 1 minute.
 Read out loud.

Wild Card Write down 3 things you love
 about yourself physically.
 Permission to brag.

Wild Card Set a time this week to
 do something you love and
 limit any distractions.

Wild Card Write down 3 things you
 wouldn't change about this
 current moment.

Wild Card Draw how your
 heart feels today.

Wild Card Write down 3 things
 about your last relationship
 that you will no longer accept
 moving forward. Get specific.

Reminder Breakups skew
 your memory. Your
 ex was not perfect.
 You will feel better.

Reminder Don't let your
 loneliness take you
 back to people who
 repeatedly hurt you.

Reminder Your love life
 is one area of your
 life. Don't forget to
 nurture the rest.

Write a final note to your
 ex that they'll never see. Get
 it all off your chest. Tear
 when you feel ready.
